    | timestamp = 01:06:17.000
    | text      = next 15 years.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:06:18.440
    | text      = Quote, the most difficult aspect of the current crisis to contain was that roughly 80% of
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:06:23.679
    | text      = non-prime loans were made by entities not subject to direct federal regulation, primarily
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:06:28.760
    | text      = mortgage bankers.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:06:30.440
    | text      = All the regulators needed to do to prevent the crisis was ban lending practices that
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:06:34.800
    | text      = were rational only for control frauds engaged in looting.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:06:38.579
    | text      = The regulators consistently refused to do so because of their anti-regulatory ideology.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:06:43.840
    | text      = He goes on to say, quote, effective financial regulatory cops on the beat are essential
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:06:49.599
    | text      = to our ability to prosecute elite white collar criminals.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:06:53.960
    | text      = Though economics is very complicated as a game, Black's argument is very simple.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:06:59.199
    | text      = There are tons of institutions that were engaged in what he calls control fraud, which is an
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:07:02.719
    | text      = idea that he pioneered, which is the idea that they take their institution and control
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:07:08.599
    | text      = it as an instrument of fraud.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:07:10.559
    | text      = The chief way that this fraud was done was in the form of stated income loans, or what
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:07:14.599
    | text      = the industry calls liar's loans, where the lender knows that the recipient of the loan
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:07:18.679
    | text      = doesn't have the ability to repay the loan and assists them in lying about their income.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:07:23.559
    | text      = According to Black's testimony, the incidence of fraud in stated income loans was nearly
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:07:27.400
    | text      = 90%.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:07:28.659
    | text      = That's a lot.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:07:29.880
    | text      = Yes.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:07:30.880
    | text      = So it's more complicated than this, but his basic point was that any institution that's
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:07:34.500
    | text      = engaged in stated income loans is pretty clearly doing so to commit a fraud and should be on
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:07:39.280
    | text      = everyone's radar.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:07:40.940
    | text      = Because of deregulation and deprioritization of this form of crime in the late 90s and
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:07:45.039
    | text      = onward, the regulators were hamstrung in terms of dealing with this, which led to what amounted
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:07:49.440
    | text      = to a decriminalization of control fraud in the large financial institutions.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:07:54.039
    | text      = In that environment, there's no incentive to play by the rules, and doing so is actually
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:07:58.039
    | text      = a great disadvantage, which increases the likelihood that the behavior will become endemic.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:08:02.519
    | text      = The problems that William Black saw in the financial world were all things that he felt
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:08:06.019
    | text      = would be taken care of with regulation and regulatory follow-up, which Alex would not
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:08:10.579
    | text      = be in favor of.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:08:12.000

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:08:23.880

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:08:45.039

{{TranscriptBlock

}}

}}
